sentences: James David Ward (born September 19, 1976) is an American musician.

A self-taught guitarist and pianist, he is the lead singer and rhythm guitarist for the band Sparta; he is also a co-founder of the post-hardcore band At the Drive-In, which he formed in 1993 when he was 17 years old.

A self-taught guitarist and pianist, he is the lead singer and rhythm guitarist for the band Sparta; he is also a co-founder of the post-hardcore band At the Drive-In, which he formed in 1993 when he was 17 years old.
He performed lead vocals on two tracks, entitled "Hourglass" and "Ursa Minor", as well as singing co-lead with lead vocalist Cedric Bixler-Zavala on a number of tracks.
On January 9, 2012, it was announced that At the Drive-In were reforming.

sentences: On March 18, 2016, days before the 2016 reunion tour would start, ATDI announced that Ward would no longer be part of the group, simply stating on their Facebook page that "As our ship prepares for voyage, we announce that Jim Ward will not be joining us on future journeys.

On March 18, 2016, days before the 2016 reunion tour would start, ATDI announced that Ward would no longer be part of the group, simply stating on their Facebook page that "As our ship prepares for voyage, we announce that Jim Ward will not be joining us on future journeys.
The band, Sparta, wrote nearly nine songs in their first week of rehearsal, with all members incorporating ideas and lyrics.
Sparta eventually signed a record contract with Geffen and released its debut album, Wiretap Scars, in 2002.
Jim Ward has announced his new album, Daggers, will be released June 11 via Dine Alone Records.
He is a 1994 graduate of El Paso High School.
